title: Medicaid 101: How Low-Income Health Coverage Works in Your State
summary: Medicaid offers free or low-cost health insurance for low-income individuals and families, but every state has different rules. This article explains who qualifies, whatâ€™s covered, and how to apply for Medicaid in your area.

body.raw:
## Introduction Healthcare is expensive â€” but if your income is low or youâ€™re facing hardship, **Medicaid** may provide the coverage you need. Itâ€™s a **state-run** program with **federal funding**, which means every state offers it â€” but the rules can vary a lot. This guide covers how Medicaid works, whoâ€™s eligible, and how to apply in your state. ## What Is Medicaid? Medicaid is a **public health insurance program** for people with low incomes. It covers essential medical services, including: - Doctor visits - Hospital stays - Mental health care - Prescriptions - Prenatal care and childbirth - Long-term care (in some cases) In most states, coverage is **free**, or has very low co-pays. ## Who Qualifies for Medicaid? Eligibility is based on your **income, household size, and specific needs**. You may qualify if you are: 1. Pregnant or recently gave birth 2. A child under 19 3. A parent or guardian of a minor 4. A person with a disability 5. A senior 65+ 6. A low-income adult (in Medicaid expansion states) Income limits vary â€” for example, a single adult earning under ~$20,000/year may qualify in many states. ## How to Apply for Medicaid The process is state-specific, but generally: 1. **Go to your stateâ€™s Medicaid website** or healthcare marketplace 2. **Submit an application** online, by phone, or in person 3. **Provide income and residency documentation** 4. **Wait for a decision** â€” approval can take days to weeks 5. **Use your benefits** with providers who accept Medicaid If youâ€™re eligible, youâ€™ll receive a Medicaid card in the mail. > ðŸ’¡ **Tip:** Even if you were denied in the past, try again â€” eligibility rules have changed in many states since the pandemic. ## Extra Medicaid Benefits Depending on your state, Medicaid may also include: - **Dental care** - **Vision services** - **Transportation to appointments** - **Behavioral health and substance abuse treatment** Some states offer **Medicaid Managed Care**, where you choose a specific provider network. *** ###### References Medicaid.gov â€“ Official Info & State Portals
Healthcare.gov â€“ Medicaid and CHIP Overview
Benefits.gov â€“ Medicaid Program Details
